defaultLetters.text: Some days, it feels like I’m barely keeping up. I know I should be chill, but it’s hard not to feel behind. Anyone else feel this way?

reply.text: I get how that feels. Sometimes it seems like everything's coming at you at once, but you'll make it through!

defaultLetters.text: Honestly, just listening before responding has been a game-changer for me. It’s simple, but it works.

reply.text: That’s such a great tip. I’ve noticed that listening first really helps create a better conversation. Thanks for sharing!

defaultLetters.text: Feels like no one notices the work I do. Maybe I should stop caring so much about others’ opinions.

reply.text: I totally understand the frustration. Sometimes it feels like we’re invisible, but your efforts do matter. Keep pushing forward!

defaultLetters.text: Love is complicated. I'm struggling to figure it all out.
Good friends are everything. They can see you at your worst and still make you feel like your best.

reply.text: Yes! I’ve had friends who’ve done that for me, and it really does make all the difference. You’re so right about the value of true friends.

defaultLetters.text: School is never-ending right now. I’m just trying to keep up and not drown in assignments.
Family can be complicated. But at the end of the day, they’re the ones who really know you.

reply.text: Trying to understand each other’s perspectives really helps.

defaultLetters.text: I’ve been feeling lonely, even when I’m surrounded by people. I just want someone who really gets it.

reply.text: I get it, I’ve been there. Even surrounded by people, the loneliness can creep in. You’re not alone in feeling this way.

defaultLetters.text: Everything feels like it’s piling up, but I keep telling myself to just take it one thing at a time.

reply.text: That’s a great mindset. One thing at a time really is the best way to handle it. Don’t let the pressure get to you!

defaultLetters.text: I’ve been trying to stay positive, but some days it’s harder than others. Focusing on what I can control helps.

reply.text: Focusing on what you can control is a great way to stay grounded during tough times.

defaultLetters.text: Love feels so out of reach sometimes, but I keep hoping something real will come along.

reply.text: Hang in there. Love can be a long journey, but real connections are worth the wait. Don’t give up hope.

defaultLetters.text: I miss having a real connection with someone. It’s hard to find friends who really get you.
Procrastination is my best friend right now... and my worst enemy. Can’t seem to get motivated today.
Family’s been tough lately, but I’m trying to remember that patience and love go a long way.
Sometimes, my thoughts feel all over the place. Writing them down at least helps me organize things.

reply.text: I do the same. Writing things down really helps clear my mind and sort through my thoughts. It’s like a little reset.

defaultLetters.text: Sometimes, it feels impossible to let out all the emotions I’ve been holding back.

reply.text: I totally understand. But don’t hold back your emotions, let it out when you can.

defaultLetters.text: I’ve been realizing how much a simple kind word can totally turn someone’s day around.
Ugh, school never lets up. Just when I think I’m on top of things, another deadline hits.
Some days I just want to take a nap and forget about everything.

reply.text: Sometimes all we need is a break to recharge. Take that nap. You deserve it!

defaultLetters.text: Feeling a little overwhelmed with work right now. I know I’ll get through it, but it’s just one of those days.

reply.text: Take it one step at a time. You’ll get through it, and soon enough, it’ll feel manageable again.

defaultLetters.text: Ever feel like you're not doing enough? I'm constantly battling that feeling, even when I'm working hard.

reply.text: I totally relate to this. It’s hard to shake that feeling, but remember, your hard work is valuable.

defaultLetters.text: Why is it that it’s always the people closest to you that can push your buttons the most?
I’m learning that it’s okay to not have everything figured out. It’s hard, but I’m trying to embrace the uncertainty.

reply.text: Embracing uncertainty is tough, but you’re on the right path.

defaultLetters.text: Been thinking a lot about love lately. It’s not always perfect, but I guess that’s what makes it real.

reply.text: Love isn’t always perfect, but the imperfections are what make it real.

defaultLetters.text: Just want to escape for a bit. Everything’s been a bit too much lately. I need a day off.
Idk why I keep saying 'I’m fine' when I’m clearly not. Do you think people actually want to hear the truth?

replies.text: Honestly, I think some people do care, but not everyone knows how to respond to honesty like that.
I feel the same way. Sometimes it's easier to say 'I’m fine' than deal with explaining everything.

defaultLetters.text: I keep procrastinating on this huge assignment, and now I have zero motivation to even start. How do y’all push through this?

replies.text: Try breaking it into smaller tasks. Starting with something small always helps me get going.
Same here. I set a timer for 20 minutes and force myself to focus. It usually works!

defaultLetters.text: My mom keeps comparing me to my older sibling. Like, I get it—they’re perfect. Can we move on now?

replies.text: That’s rough. Maybe talk to her about how it makes you feel?

defaultLetters.text: Anyone else randomly get hit with the feeling like you’re not doing enough with your life? Or just me? 😂

replies.text: Literally all the time. It helps to write down small wins so you remember you’re making progress.

defaultLetters.text: My best friend just got into a relationship, and I’m so happy for them, but also… now I feel super alone. Is that selfish?

replies.text: It’s not selfish at all. Your feelings are valid, and it’s okay to feel that way.

defaultLetters.text: Okay but seriously, how do you even start making new friends as an adult? It feels impossible.

replies.text: Try joining hobby groups or going to meetups. It feels awkward at first, but it gets better!

defaultLetters.text: Does anyone else feel super weird visiting their childhood home? It’s like the memories hit you all at once.

replies.text: Yes! It’s like stepping into a time capsule of emotions.

defaultLetters.text: I told my crush I liked them, and now they’re acting distant. Did I totally ruin things? 🥲

replies.text: Maybe they just need time to process. It’s brave of you to share your feelings.

defaultLetters.text: Why is it so hard to just ask for help? Like, I know I need it, but something always stops me.

replies.text: Same. I think it’s because we’re afraid of being judged, but asking for help shows strength.

defaultLetters.text: Weird question, but what’s something small that makes you happy? I need ideas to boost my mood today.

replies.text: Watching the sunset always lifts my mood.
Listening to my favorite song on repeat helps me a lot.

defaultLetters.text: I’ve been thinking about switching my major, but I’m scared I’ll regret it. Anyone been through this?
I love my friends, but I feel like I can’t talk to them about serious stuff. How do you even bring that up?
Today I saw a little kid give their ice cream to another kid who dropped theirs, and honestly, it melted my heart. We need more kindness like that.
Do you ever just stare at your to-do list and feel so overwhelmed you end up doing nothing at all? Because same.
Is it normal to feel closer to online friends than people IRL? Sometimes I feel like I can be more myself with them.
Finally passed my driving test after failing twice! Guess I’m not as bad as I thought.
How do you forgive someone who isn’t even sorry? I keep thinking about this, and it’s eating me up inside.

replies.text: Sometimes understanding that there are people who you should let go of even though in your heart of hearts you don't want to is best for you.

defaultLetters.text: I want to say I love you to someone, but I’m terrified they won’t say it back. What would you do?
I’ve been overthinking a conversation I had last week. Like, do they think I’m weird now? Ugh, brain, please chill.

replies.text: I do this all the time. Honestly, they probably haven’t even thought about it since then!
Overthinking is the worst. Maybe try distracting yourself with something fun?

defaultLetters.text: What do you do when it feels like everything in life is moving forward, but you’re stuck in the same place?

replies.text: I felt this way last year. Sometimes small steps forward are still progress—don’t discount them.

defaultLetters.text: Random thought: When’s the last time you told someone you’re proud of them? I think we need to do that more often.
I found this old photo of me and my grandparents, and now I’m just sitting here crying. I miss them so much.

replies.text: Photos like that are so bittersweet. It’s okay to miss them. They must’ve meant a lot to you.

defaultLetters.text: How do you stop comparing yourself to others? It’s like I know I shouldn’t, but it’s so hard not to.

replies.text: I get it—it’s so tough. I try to focus on my own goals instead of theirs, even if it’s hard.
Remember, you’re only seeing their highlight reel, not their struggles.

defaultLetters.text: Got my first A on an assignment this semester! Feels good to finally have something go right for once.

replies.text: Congrats! That’s awesome—you earned it!

defaultLetters.text: Do you ever just stare at your phone waiting for a text that never comes? Yeah, me too.
If you could give your younger self one piece of advice, what would it be? I think mine would be to stop worrying so much.

replies.text: Mine would be to take more risks. Younger me played it too safe.
